casebody.data:
James J. NUNEZ, Plaintiff-Appellant v. CITY OF TEXAS CITY, TEXAS, Defendant-Appellee. No. 09-41017

Summary Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. May 4, 2010. Anthony P. Griffin, Anthony P. Griffin Inc., Galveston, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellant. Susan L. Bickley, Abrams Scott & Bick-ley, L.L.P., Houston, TX, for Defendant-Appellee. *358Before JOLLY, WIENER, and ELROD, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM: *

Plaintiff-Appellant James J. Nunez, a firefighter for Defendant-Appellee City of Texas City, Texas before he was fired by the Fire Chief effective October 15, 2001, appeals the district court’s Final Judgment of September 3, 2009, granting summary judgment of dismissal with prejudice of Nunez’s claim that his firing was grounded in racial discrimination. Having reviewed the record on appeal in light of the applicable law presented by the parties in their appellate briefs as applied to the relevant facts, we conclude that the district court properly granted the City’s motion for summary judgment, dismissing Nunez’s action, for the reasons exhaustively and correctly set forth in that court’s Memorandum and Order signed on September 3, 2009. AFFIRMED.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
